title: If man’s law violates God’s law, do you violate man’s law in order to keep God’s? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: If man’s law violates God’s law, do you violate man’s law in order to keep gods? There might be two things that come into conflict where you would have to make a tough decision, but you’ve chosen the wrong two things. If man’s law violates our moral conscience, we should both strive to fix the law and be conscientious objectors where appropriate. If God’s law violates our moral conscience, we should again be conscientious objectors where appropriate. If you belong to a church that doesn’t allow people of different races to marry, you should step up and say that this is wrong. Similarly if they don’t allow two people of the same sex to marry. If there were laws like in Nazi Germany, of course you should violate these laws as a reasonable conscience would dictate.

A long time ago when I was a young Lieutenant, a Major was lecturing my class on the duty to obey lawful orders. During a pause, I raised my hand and posed this question: “What if an order is legal, but immoral? In Nazi Germany it was legal to shoot Jews!” The Major became quite angry, and blew off my question with, “Oh, that’s an extreme example that would never happen here. In this military, you just obey!” Discretion being a great virtue, I didn’t press the point.  There are situations where a higher moral code overrides any legal code. George Washington broke British laws. Martin Luther King broke segregation laws. All people must be willing to obey their consciences rather than unjust laws, for this is the only guarantee against despotism.

If man’s law violates God’s law, do you violate man’s law in order to keep gods? Before I care about your god’s law, I have to know which god, out of the thousands out there.. which one it is… then you need to demonstrate that your god actually exists. Then we can get onto the conversation on if we are violating your god’s laws, and intern we can talk about whether we are violating laws to keep your god’s law.

I am answering as a Christian. Man’s law does not always violate God’s law. When it does, however, for those of us who know God for who He is, God’s laws take priority. And so, we are ready to violate man’s law and suffer man’s punishment for it, even if it means being killed for what we believe.

If man’s law violates God’s law, do you violate man’s law in order to keep gods? Since nobody knows what God has to say, or knows whether or not he exists, it is best to go with human law over any law said to be the law of God. Note that the laws found in religious texts were written by men, so they are man’s law according to ancient primitives who had a poor sense of morality compared to modern humans.

If you want to “violate man’s law in order to keep god[’s law]”, all you need do first is to get God themselves to come down here and PROVE beyond any doubt that it IS their law. Anything short of that would be a man claiming to know God’s will with no real proof. Which is basically the case with every religious text in existence (Torah, Bible and Quran included), and why so many non-believers have trouble taking your word for it.
No. God’s law were invented by men centuries ago to keep power over simple people. There is no such thing as god or god’s law.
